title: JD Vance’s Miss South Carolina joke on Kamala Harris backfires: ‘Try to have some fun,’ he tells outraged critics
content: JD Vance tried to mock Kamala Harris by posting a clip of Miss South Carolina Teen USA Caitlin Upton's 2007 pageant error. The tweet faced backlash for perceived sexism. Upton discussed the lasting negative effects on her life. Vance defended his post, highlighting the need for humor in politics.
summary: JD Vance tried to mock Kamala Harris by posting a clip of Miss South Carolina Teen USA Caitlin Upton's 2007 pageant error. The tweet faced backlash for perceived sexism. Upton discussed the lasting negative effects on her life. Vance defended his post, highlighting the need for humor in politics.

title: Government working on IMF conditions for loan programme: Pakistan PM Shehbaz
Russia says Telegram boss Durov is a victim of his own independence
content: Telegram CEO Pavel Durov was arrested in France and faces investigation for alleged involvement in illegal activities on his platform. Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov claims this is a Western political strategy. The Kremlin supports Durov, while French President Emmanuel Macron denies any political motives behind the arrest.
summary: Telegram CEO Pavel Durov was arrested in France and faces investigation for alleged involvement in illegal activities on his platform. Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov claims this is a Western political strategy. The Kremlin supports Durov, while French President Emmanuel Macron denies any political motives behind the arrest.

title: August deadliest month in Balochistan in six years, reports say
content: The Pakistan Institute for Conflict and Security Studies reported that August was the most violent month in Balochistan in six years. Across Pakistan, 254 people were killed primarily due to militant attacks. Quetta, Kech, Awaran, and Khuzdar experienced high numbers of enforced disappearances. The region faces ongoing violence and severe human rights abuses.
summary: The Pakistan Institute for Conflict and Security Studies reported that August was the most violent month in Balochistan in six years. Across Pakistan, 254 people were killed primarily due to militant attacks. Quetta, Kech, Awaran, and Khuzdar experienced high numbers of enforced disappearances. The region faces ongoing violence and severe human rights abuses.

title: Who is Lara Trump? Social media rips her singing: ‘She croaks like a frog’ - See why
content: Lara Trump, the wife of Eric Trump, released her new single 'Hero' on Labor Day. The tribute to emergency responders quickly went viral but faced severe backlash for its heavily auto-tuned sound. Social media users and political commentators harshly criticized the song, questioning her musical talent and decision to pursue singing.
summary: Lara Trump, the wife of Eric Trump, released her new single 'Hero' on Labor Day. The tribute to emergency responders quickly went viral but faced severe backlash for its heavily auto-tuned sound. Social media users and political commentators harshly criticized the song, questioning her musical talent and decision to pursue singing.

title: Hindu American silence: How Usha Vance’s faith shapes Trump-Vance campaign this US election
content: Usha Vance, wife of VP candidate JD Vance, discussed their interfaith marriage at the RNC but did not mention her Hindu upbringing due to online vitriol. While her presence may attract some Indian American voters, it highlights ongoing challenges for non-Christian identities within the Republican Party.
summary: Usha Vance, wife of VP candidate JD Vance, discussed their interfaith marriage at the RNC but did not mention her Hindu upbringing due to online vitriol. While her presence may attract some Indian American voters, it highlights ongoing challenges for non-Christian identities within the Republican Party.

title: Nasa identifies 'strange noises' from Starliner capsule as audio feedback
content: Astronaut Butch Wilmore reported hearing unusual noises from Boeing's Starliner capsule, which were identified as audio feedback from an audio configuration with the ISS. The issue did not impact operations. Wilmore and fellow astronaut Sunita Williams will return to Earth in February 2025 aboard SpaceX's Dragon capsule. Starliner will return uncrewed in September 2024.
summary: Astronaut Butch Wilmore reported hearing unusual noises from Boeing's Starliner capsule, which were identified as audio feedback from an audio configuration with the ISS. The issue did not impact operations. Wilmore and fellow astronaut Sunita Williams will return to Earth in February 2025 aboard SpaceX's Dragon capsule. Starliner will return uncrewed in September 2024.

title: Did Pavel Durov get plastic surgery? Telegram CEO’s jaw-dropping transformation sparks rumors amid arrest
content: Pavel Durov, Telegram’s co-founder and CEO, has recently been in the news due to his arrest in France and a significant change in his appearance. Side-by-side photos show a drastic transformation, sparking speculation about plastic surgery. This development coincides with legal issues involving Durov's app, intensifying media scrutiny.
summary: Pavel Durov, Telegram’s co-founder and CEO, has recently been in the news due to his arrest in France and a significant change in his appearance. Side-by-side photos show a drastic transformation, sparking speculation about plastic surgery. This development coincides with legal issues involving Durov's app, intensifying media scrutiny.

title: Optimum faces major outage in Metro New York: Over 9,000 users report mass internet disruption, frustration follow
content: A major service outage affected Optimum customers in Metro New York from 8 pm on Monday. The interruptions impacted thousands, with reports peaking at over 9,700 users. Customer service experienced significant delays. Optimum's support team acknowledged the problem on its official account, pledging efforts to restore services promptly but providing no estimated repair time.
summary: A major service outage affected Optimum customers in Metro New York from 8 pm on Monday. The interruptions impacted thousands, with reports peaking at over 9,700 users. Customer service experienced significant delays. Optimum's support team acknowledged the problem on its official account, pledging efforts to restore services promptly but providing no estimated repair time.

title: JD Vance's awkward fist bump: Watch Rep. Kaptur and Senator's unforgettable picket line moment
content: A video from October 2023 featuring Rep. Marcy Kaptur and Sen. JD Vance at a UAW picket line in Toledo has gone viral. The clip humorously captures an awkward greeting moment between the politicians, underscoring their contrasting views on the UAW strike and automotive industry policies, including the electric vehicle transition.
summary: A video from October 2023 featuring Rep. Marcy Kaptur and Sen. JD Vance at a UAW picket line in Toledo has gone viral. The clip humorously captures an awkward greeting moment between the politicians, underscoring their contrasting views on the UAW strike and automotive industry policies, including the electric vehicle transition.

title: Who is Daisuke Hori? Japanese man who has slept only 30 minutes a day for 12 years – Is it possible?
content: Daisuke Hori, a Japanese entrepreneur, has slept just 30 minutes per day for 12 years to improve productivity. He founded the Japan Short Sleepers Training Association and trained over 2,100 students. Hori’s daily routine includes work and gym sessions, which he fits into his extended waking hours. Health experts warn against chronic sleep deprivation risks. The approach has sparked debates online.
summary: Daisuke Hori, a Japanese entrepreneur, has slept just 30 minutes per day for 12 years to improve productivity. He founded the Japan Short Sleepers Training Association and trained over 2,100 students. Hori’s daily routine includes work and gym sessions, which he fits into his extended waking hours. Health experts warn against chronic sleep deprivation risks. The approach has sparked debates online.

title: Who is Dimas Gabriel Yanez? Illegal immigrant armed with 'butcher-style' knife stabs teen girl in Illinois at baseball game
content: A previously deported migrant, Dimas Gabriel Yanez, was arrested for stabbing a 14-year-old girl at a baseball game in Lowell, Illinois. After attacking, Yanez attempted to flee but was captured following a thorough manhunt. The victim was treated and released. The arrest has reignited discussions on immigration policies and public safety.
summary: A previously deported migrant, Dimas Gabriel Yanez, was arrested for stabbing a 14-year-old girl at a baseball game in Lowell, Illinois. After attacking, Yanez attempted to flee but was captured following a thorough manhunt. The victim was treated and released. The arrest has reignited discussions on immigration policies and public safety.

title: Titanic wreckage shows major damage in new photos: Missing bow railing, rare 'Diana of Versailles' statue found
content: New photos reveal the Titanic wreck's ongoing decay in the North Atlantic. A section of the deck railing has broken off, and the 'Diana of Versailles' statue was rediscovered. The first visit in 14 years, RMS Titanic, Inc. captured millions of high-resolution images to monitor the wreck's condition. The company expressed sadness over the loss and acknowledged the inevitable decay of the ship, noting that their mission is to preserve and document as much as possible before it’s too late.
summary: New photos reveal the Titanic wreck's ongoing decay in the North Atlantic. A section of the deck railing has broken off, and the 'Diana of Versailles' statue was rediscovered. The first visit in 14 years, RMS Titanic, Inc. captured millions of high-resolution images to monitor the wreck's condition. The company expressed sadness over the loss and acknowledged the inevitable decay of the ship, noting that their mission is to preserve and document as much as possible before it’s too late.

title: Gunshots to the 'back of the head': Netanyahu on six hostages Killed by Hamas
content: In response to the brutal execution of six hostages by Hamas, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu rejected any concessions in the Gaza ceasefire negotiations. He emphasized the importance of maintaining control over the Philadelphi corridor and called for increased global pressure on Hamas to end the conflict, highlighting the severe humanitarian crisis in Gaza.
summary: In response to the brutal execution of six hostages by Hamas, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu rejected any concessions in the Gaza ceasefire negotiations. He emphasized the importance of maintaining control over the Philadelphi corridor and called for increased global pressure on Hamas to end the conflict, highlighting the severe humanitarian crisis in Gaza.

title: China school bus crash: 11 dead after vehicle hits group of students in Shandong
content: In Tai'an city, Shandong province, a school bus lost control and struck a group of parents and children near a middle school entrance. "As of now, (the incident) has caused the deaths of 11 people, of whom six were parents and five were students," CCTV broadcaster said. It said that one individual is currently in a "critical" condition, while another 12 people are in "stable" condition.
summary: In Tai'an city, Shandong province, a school bus lost control and struck a group of parents and children near a middle school entrance. "As of now, (the incident) has caused the deaths of 11 people, of whom six were parents and five were students," CCTV broadcaster said. It said that one individual is currently in a "critical" condition, while another 12 people are in "stable" condition.

title: Did Kamala Harris 'fake her accent' in Teachers Union speech? Social media reacts
content: During a Labor Day rally in Detroit, Vice President Kamala Harris faced criticism for allegedly using a different accent. Social media reactions included accusations of inauthenticity, with some users claiming she adopted a fake southern accent. The speech aimed to attract blue-collar union worker votes, but it generated mixed responses online.
summary: During a Labor Day rally in Detroit, Vice President Kamala Harris faced criticism for allegedly using a different accent. Social media reactions included accusations of inauthenticity, with some users claiming she adopted a fake southern accent. The speech aimed to attract blue-collar union worker votes, but it generated mixed responses online.

title: Trump speaks out on assassination attempt: ‘Maybe God wants me to fix our country’
content: Former President Trump discussed how surviving a near-death experience during a Pennsylvania rally has strengthened his faith in God. Praising the Secret Service's quick action, he speculated that his survival could be for the purpose of aiding the country. He also commented on challenging the 2020 election results and the impact on his poll numbers.
summary: Former President Trump discussed how surviving a near-death experience during a Pennsylvania rally has strengthened his faith in God. Praising the Secret Service's quick action, he speculated that his survival could be for the purpose of aiding the country. He also commented on challenging the 2020 election results and the impact on his poll numbers.

title: Did Trump just confess to a crime on TV? Breaking down his election interference claims from latest interview
content: In a recent interview, Donald Trump stated he had "every right" to interfere in the 2020 election, which has led to sharp criticism. Former federal prosecutor Joyce Vance and legal analysts question the legality and implication of his comments. Trump's legal team seeks delays in the case, citing a Supreme Court ruling on presidential immunity.
summary: In a recent interview, Donald Trump stated he had "every right" to interfere in the 2020 election, which has led to sharp criticism. Former federal prosecutor Joyce Vance and legal analysts question the legality and implication of his comments. Trump's legal team seeks delays in the case, citing a Supreme Court ruling on presidential immunity.

title: California's Rancho Palos Verdes hit hard by landslide: Power cut, evacuations, emergency funding announced
content: Landslides in Rancho Palos Verdes have worsened, causing power cuts to 245 homes. The shifting ground poses safety threats, damaging homes and infrastructure. Southern California Edison cut power, warning residents not to use plumbing. Local authorities seek state and federal aid, highlighting the need for a larger response as the situation accelerates.
summary: Landslides in Rancho Palos Verdes have worsened, causing power cuts to 245 homes. The shifting ground poses safety threats, damaging homes and infrastructure. Southern California Edison cut power, warning residents not to use plumbing. Local authorities seek state and federal aid, highlighting the need for a larger response as the situation accelerates.

title: Angry Israelis push Netanyahu’s red lines on hostage deaths
content: Following the discovery of six Israeli hostages' bodies in Gaza, Prime Minister Netanyahu expressed sorrow to their families, a significant moment in the conflict with Hamas. The public’s demand for a cease-fire and strategic shifts in handling hostages have intensified. The US and international brokers are pressing for a final agreement.
summary: Following the discovery of six Israeli hostages' bodies in Gaza, Prime Minister Netanyahu expressed sorrow to their families, a significant moment in the conflict with Hamas. The public’s demand for a cease-fire and strategic shifts in handling hostages have intensified. The US and international brokers are pressing for a final agreement.
